result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Keontae Amircovan Williams

defendant.name: Williams, Keontae Amircovan
defendant.address: 5742 West Silver Spring Drive, Milwaukee, WI 53218

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Keontae Amircovan Williams in court.  Attorney William Hotchkiss in court for Keontae Amircovan Williams.  Prosecuting attorney David T. Malone in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant has not completed any of the terms of agreement, due to reasons put forth on the record. Defendant needs to complete the firearm safety class, essay, and community service hours in order to receive the benefits of the agreement. Case adjourned to Branch 17.
Review hearing scheduled for January 17, 2023 at 09:15 am.

Defendant Keontae Amircovan Williams in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Keontae Amircovan Williams appeared by video means with Attorney.
Case in court for Deferred Prosecution Agreement hearing. State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. 
Court is in receipt of  the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; Plea Questionnaire, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Elements of the Offense.
Court finds defendant knowingly and willingly WAIVED his  right to have an in person hearing and agreed to proceed by Electronic Means.
 
The parties have agreed to a deferred judgment agreement. 
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and entered a plea of GUILTY
Defendant  examined as to the plea.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  
The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
The Court reviewed the Early Intervention Program Deferred Prosecution Agreement with the defendant.  
The court approved the Deferred Prosecution Agreement and ordered the proceedings suspended until Review Hearing.  
Parties informed this matter has been reassigned to Judge Davis Br. 21. Review Hearing scheduled.

Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to branch 17, Judge Carolina Stark, in Room 400 of the Courthouse.
  Review hearing scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Keontae Amircovan Williams in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Keontae Amircovan Williams appeared by video means with Attorney.  
Case in court for status conference. Defense requests DPA resolution date. Case adjourned to Branch 30.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Keontae Amircovan Williams in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Keontae Amircovan Williams appeared by video means with Attorney.  
Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests more time to review case.  Case remains calendared in Branch 30. Status Conference is scheduled on June 03, 2022 at 10:30am.

As a condition of bail, court order the defendant may not possess dangerous weapons or firearms or apply for a conceal carry permit.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Keontae Amircovan Williams in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Keontae Amircovan Williams appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
Case heard via Zoom.   Defendant waives In Person appearance.
  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defense waived reading and momentarily enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of client.
  DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 4:00 P.M. ON 4/4/2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant no longer wishes to enter into a DPA. Case reassigned to Judge Richards Branch 30. Case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in branch 30.
  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
